name: Hyatt Regency Toronto

reviews.text: I live about an hour away from Toronto but me and my partner stayed here because we wanted a mini weekend getaway. The package included 2 tickets to Second City which is an improve stage comedy club which was also awesome. The Hyatt was easy to find with lots of underground parking. The hotel is modern and clean with 2 bars and private elevators. After 10pm they have security outside the elevators to make sure only hotel guests are allowed inside. We felt very safe! The shower in the washroom was beautiful with glass doors and limestone tiles, while the king size bed boasted at least 6 pillows and the flat screen tv was really a focal point of the room. Add the awesome view of the CN Tower outside my window and this hotel completely outdid my expectations! I'd recommend it to anyone and I'm sure I'll be back. Oh ps the neighbourhood is safe and fun with over 150 restaurants within walking distance! Makes it feel like a mini New York holiday.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: Good restaurants and market food and lcbo near.
reviews.title: Good location for visiting the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great rooms and beautiful lobby.
reviews.title: Great New Years at the Hyatt

reviews.text: Nice gym.
reviews.title: You pay for the great location with extra fees...

reviews.text: At 199$ little expensive but this is a 4star in a good location.
reviews.title: Has Hyatt Slipped?

reviews.text: We got a great deal on Priceline for this hotel. Best thing about this hotel is the location and the front desk staff. The decor is a bit weird, and our room needed a serious vacuuming and dusting. But, when we mentioned it to the desk staff the comped our parking ($30), a nice touch.
reviews.title: Helpful desk staff, room could've been cleaner

reviews.text: The Hyatt Regency Toronto is a great spot to stay if you just want to experience/explore downtown Toronto. If you don't mind walking around the core of the city, it is in my opinion one of the better spots to stay. The hotel did at one time go under the brand of Holiday Inn but was sold and and had somewhat of an upgrade to it's features and amenities.
reviews.title: Weekends in Toronto !!

reviews.text: The times I stayed here was just for a weekend in Toronto for a couple of NHL Leafs/Flyers games at the ACC. Each time was great. Comfortable rooms with everything you need, although I would suggest that they put mini-fridges in the rooms. The staff were excellent and expedient. Every time I head to Toronto I try to stay at the Hyatt Regency Toronto. It's also a block away from Mountain Equipment Co-op which for me is hard to stay away from since we don't have one in Newfoundland!!!
reviews.title: Great service, very clean, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Hyatt for one night to attend a conference that was held on site. The beds are SUPER comfortable but the rooms need a mirror in the guest room itself. When two people are in a room and one is in the bathroom, the other person is likely getting ready outside of the bathroom and needs a mirror to do so. Most hotels have a full-length mirror. This is a small nit, though. It was very clean and safe and the service was great. There are tons of restaurants to choose from across the street. I would probably stay here again if the price was right.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here in January of 2012 with my boyfriend for a nice night in the city. Decent hotel, but definitely not anything special.
reviews.title: Great location, close to everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel for Valentines Day on priceline and got an amazing deal. I've heard a lot of good things about this hotel so I was excited to check out this hotel. This hotel was a perfect getaway with my girlfriend and it exceeded our expectations.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel - Great for Valentines Day!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove one car as reading the reviews from this site indicated that parking is quite expensive to help reduce our costs. My cousin actually lives in the area so we parked the car at her condo. If you are going to drive and park - I would recommend the parking lot across the hotel as it offers a competitive price to all the other lots in the area.
reviews.title: Decent hotel- Fantastic location

reviews.text: The hotel was absolutely beautiful. The ambience of the hotel was amazing and the staff are extremely nice and sincere. Sam the manager checked me in and upgraded me to a balcony room which gave a beautiful view of the city line. This was perfect for valentines day and my girlfriend loved the view. Unfortunately the balcony door wasn't working so we couldn't go outside - but since this was a free upgrade, I really couldn't complain.
reviews.title: Great Location Downtown!

reviews.text: The room was extremely spacious with a LCD TV and washroom was really clean. The bed was really comfortable and the cleaning staff were really nice. I left my phone in the room and the cleaning staff were really nice to hang on to the phone for me. One of the downsides of this hotel was that there was no refridgerator in the room but there was a safe for your valuables.
reviews.title: Eh... Old hotel in a decent location

reviews.text: We did not visit the pool or the restaurant - hence I cannot comment on it. There is a starbucks connected to the hotel which was really convenient.
reviews.title: 'Questionable' policy at the Hyatt

reviews.text: Had a great time at the Hyatt Regency in Toronto in June of 2011. The staff were courteous and helpful, the new look to the hotel was impressive and we received a free room upgrade for being Hyatt Gold Members. Well done. Will go back!
reviews.title: Hyatt Regency Toronto

reviews.text: I was wowed by the check in. This group has obviously been not only trained well but really likes interacting with guests. No it was not contrived. This is a Hyatt and so far I'm very impressed and comfortable with the level of service. it's a normal first class experience. The concierge is worth talking to for any recommendations you may need. The room is spotless ....I'm here right now room 1019. Was concerned after reading some of the reviews on tripadvisor that the rooms were outdated and the staff cold. Check my profile I'm a tripadvisor senior advisor .....I can tell you that this is a fantastic hotel...boutique rooms....spotless and staff that goes beyond the expected. Very nice so far with one exception The Internet connection sucks ....worse than dial up and i need a quick or at least a normal connection in order to stay here again The Internet 3rd party connection is so spotty I may have to change hotels and lose out as Im here on a 3 day prepaid priceline deal
reviews.title: Fantastic. Thanks Hyatt but your Internet sucks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are many rooms at the Hyatt Regency that offer stunning views of the city and CN Tower, as well as being walking distance from the CN Tower, Steam Whistle Brewery and other attractions. Ours in particular would've been perfect except for the lighting poles and utility balcony that was obstructing the view (although I cannot blame the Hyatt for this because certainly not every room can have an unobstructed view). The decor is a modern/contemporary style and the hotel carries a subtle elegancy. The room I stayed in could use a detailed cleaning though (cobwebs, large number of marks on the walls, bathtub had some sort of film in it). The staff is courteous and friendly, and was very helpful in giving us ideas for how to get around the city as this was our first time visiting Toronto. As many others have mentioned, the parking is a stiff at $29 per night. I tried to ask the parking attendant in the basement deck about just paying them directly and they told me "If you are checking in at the hotel, you must register with them". I did, however in retrospect I suppose I never had to even mention the hotel to the parking attendant and should've just kept my mouth shut so I could just pay the $15/day. If you are a AAA member I recommend getting the breakfast package because the breakfast offered in the restaurant, although very good and beautiful plate presentation, is grossly overpriced. Overall this is a very nice hotel, I would stay again if I visited, but perhaps look into which floors have the best views and do your research about meals/parking.
reviews.title: Great location and views, but at a cost.

reviews.text: This is not an ideal hotel with young kids as there was no pool and the restaurant prices and deals are not geared toward families like those at Sheraton. Although the hotel lobby is nice with modern decor, the sterile and metallic feeling gives the welcoming sensation geared towards young urban professionals instead of families. Same with the room decor which is retro modern although fairly comfortable beds. The cleaning is spotty as I found damaged earrings at corner of bathroom. Would be good for business stay but a bit far for walk to bay street. The staff is excellent.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but not central location

reviews.text: I work in the hotel industry, so I tend to sympathize with the staff. However, this hotel was a pretty bad experience.
reviews.title: What a Mess

description: Located in the heart of Toronto Entertainment District, central downtown, is the beautiful Hyatt Regency Toronto. Boasting 394 guestrooms including 32 deluxe suites on 20 floors. Typical guestroom features include 42inch plasma television, iPod Docking station, multi-media interface capabilities, massaging showerhead and other comforts of home. For business or pleasure, the Hyatt Regency Toronto provides the perfect location for anywhere you need to be in Toronto.
